member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationMode
member.summary: Controls the behavior of authentication middleware

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationMode.Active
member.summary: In Active mode the authentication middleware will alter the user identity as the request arrives, and will also alter a plain 401 as the response leaves.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationMode.Passive
member.summary: In Passive mode the authentication middleware will only provide user identity when asked, and will only alter 401 responses where the authentication type named in the extra challenge data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: Base Options for all authentication middleware

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationOptions.AuthenticationType
member.summary: The AuthenticationType in the options corresponds to the IIdentity AuthenticationType property. A different value may be assigned in order to use the same authentication middleware type more than once in a pipeline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationOptions.AuthenticationMode
member.summary: If Active the authentication middleware alter the request user coming in and alter 401 Unauthorized responses going out. If Passive the authentication middleware will only provide identity and alter responses when explicitly indicated by the AuthenticationType.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationOptions.Description
member.summary: Additional information about the authentication type which is made available to the application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationTicket
member.summary: Contains user identity information as well as additional authentication state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationTicket.#ctor(System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.Security.AuthenticationProperties)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationTicket.Identity
member.summary: Gets the authenticated user identity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthenticationTicket.Properties
member.summary: Additional state values for the authentication session.

member.summary: The user to check the claims against.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthorizationPolicyContext.UserClaims
member.summary: The claims of the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthorizationPolicyContext.Resource
member.summary: An optional resource associated to the check.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthorizationPolicyContext.Authorized
member.summary: Gets or set whether the permission will be granted to the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.AuthorizationPolicyContext.Retry
member.summary: When set to true, the authorization check will be processed again.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Resources.Exception_AuthenticationTokenDoesNotProvideSyncMethods
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The AuthenticationTokenProvider's required synchronous events have not been registered..

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Resources.Exception_DefaultDpapiRequiresAppNameKey
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The default data protection provider may only be used when the IApplicationBuilder.Properties contains an appropriate 'host.AppName' key..

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Resources.Exception_MissingDefaultSignInAsAuthenticationType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A default value for SignInAsAuthenticationType was not found in IApplicationBuilder Properties. This can happen if your authentication middleware are added in the wrong order, or if one is missing..

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Resources.Exception_UnhookAuthenticationStateType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The state passed to UnhookAuthentication may only be the return value from HookAuthentication..

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.SubjectPublicKeyInfoAlgorithm
member.summary: The algorithm used to generate the subject public key information blob hashes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler
member.summary: Base class for the per-request work performed by most authentication middleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.TeardownAsync
member.summary: Called once per request after Initialize and Invoke.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.InvokeAsync
member.summary: Called once by common code after initialization. If an authentication middleware responds directly to specifically known paths it must override this virtual, compare the request path to it's known paths, provide any response information as appropriate, and true to stop further processing.
member.returns: Returning false will cause the common code to call the next middleware in line. Returning true will cause the common code to begin the async completion journey without calling the rest of the middleware pipeline.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.AuthenticateAsync
member.summary:
Causes the authentication logic in AuthenticateCore to be performed for the current request at most once and returns the results. Calling Authenticate more than once will always return the original value.
This method should always be called instead of calling AuthenticateCore directly.
member.returns: The ticket data provided by the authentication logic

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.AuthenticateCoreAsync
member.summary: The core authentication logic which must be provided by the handler. Will be invoked at most once per request. Do not call directly, call the wrapping Authenticate method instead.
member.returns: The ticket data provided by the authentication logic

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponseAsync
member.summary: Causes the ApplyResponseCore to be invoked at most once per request. This method will be invoked either earlier, when the response headers are sent as a result of a response write or flush, or later, as the last step when the original async call to the middleware is returning.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponseCoreAsync
member.summary: Core method that may be overridden by handler. The default behavior is to call two common response activities, one that deals with sign-in/sign-out concerns, and a second to deal with 401 challenges.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponseGrantAsync
member.summary: Override this method to dela with sign-in/sign-out concerns, if an authentication scheme in question deals with grant/revoke as part of it's request flow. (like setting/deleting cookies)

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponseChallengeAsync
member.summary: Override this method to deal with 401 challenge concerns, if an authentication scheme in question deals an authentication interaction as part of it's request flow. (like adding a response header, or changing the 401 result to 302 of a login page or external sign-in location.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler`1
member.summary: Base class for the per-request work performed by most authentication middleware.
member.typeparam: Specifies which type for of AuthenticationOptions property

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler`1.Initialize(`0,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Initialize is called once per request to contextualize this instance with appropriate state.
member.param: The original options passed by the application control behavior
The utility object to observe the current request and response

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CryptEncodeObject(System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,Microsoft.Win32.NativeMethods.CERT_PUBLIC_KEY_INFO@,System.Byte[],System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Encodes a structure of the type indicated by the value of the lpszStructType parameter.
member.param: Type of encoding used.

The high-order word is zero, the low-order word specifies the integer identifier for the type of the specified structure so we can use the constants in http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa378145%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
A pointer to the structure to be encoded.
A pointer to a buffer to receive the encoded structure. This parameter can be NULL to retrieve the size of this information for memory allocation purposes.
A pointer to a DWORD variable that contains the size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the pbEncoded parameter.
